newsitem.title: USA: No plans by Continental to drop cargo surcharge.
newsitem.headline: No plans by Continental to drop cargo surcharge.

text.p: Continental Airlines has no plans to drop its cargo fuel surcharge in the wake of a move by United Airlines to drop its surcharge on April 7, a Continental official said.
A majority of large North American carriers, including American, Northwest, Air Canada and Canadian Airlines say they will retain their surcharges, while monitoring market conditions.
Delta dropped its surcharge earlier in the month.
Continental Cargo marketing manager Dana Bates told Reuters the way her airline purchases fuel, it has not seen a significant benefit of recent lower prices.
Most carriers say their fuel costs remain well above year-ago levels.
Among North American carriers, Continental has been one of the most aggressive purchasers of hedge contracts to protect its fuel cost exposure.
Bates noted that United is removing its surcharge at a time when it is also raising many of its international rates.
Continental has no plans to raise any rates right now, she added.
